dataset.name: best fit
dataset.desc:
IMP 8 Solar Wind Plasma Faraday Cup Data
Sampling: 58S
Provider: NSSDC

parameter.name: density
parameter.description: (Better, from fits) Proton number density

parameter.name: v_bulk
parameter.description: (Better, from fits) Ion Flow Velocity (aberration corrected)

parameter.name: v_thermal
parameter.description: (Better, from fits) Proton most-probable thermal speed (aberration corrected). Thermal speed is the most probable thermal speed (i.e., the square root of [2kT/m(proton)]). To convert thermal speed to temperature in eV, multiply 0.0052 by the square of the thermal speed; to convert to temperature [K], multiply the square of the thermal speed by 60.5.

parameter.name: flow angle e/w
parameter.description: (Best, from fits) Proton East/West flow angle (aberration corrected). Azimuth is E/W, meaning bulk flow from the East or the West side of the Sun respectively. Positive azimuth angle means flow from the West.

parameter.name: flow angle n/s
parameter.description: (Best, from fits) Proton North/South flow angle (aberration corrected). Azimuth is N/S, meaning bulk flow from the North or the South side of the Sun respectively. Positive azimuth angle means flow from the North.

parameter.description: Velocity vector component uncertainties

dataset.name: parameters from sweeps (ASW)
dataset.desc:
Analyzed sweeps (ASW). Miscellaneous physical high-level quantities derived from individual sweeps.
MinSampling: 0.016S; MaxSampling: 128S
Provider: PSA

parameter.name: n_e_fix_t
parameter.description: Electron density derived from individual sweep. An electron temperature is assumed to be fixed (value of 5 eV)

parameter.name: n_e_fix_t : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data

parameter.name: t_e
parameter.description: Electron temperature derived from exponential part of sweep

parameter.name: t_e : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data

parameter.name: t_e_xcal
parameter.description: Electron temperature, derived by using the linear part of the electron current of the sweep, and density measurement from RPCMIP.

parameter.name: t_e_xcal : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data

parameter.name: i_ph0_s
parameter.description: Photosaturation current derived from individual sweep. As LAP1 has shown no significant contamination effects, these estimates should be directly proportional to the EUV flux at Rosetta position in the 20-130 nm band.

parameter.name: i_ph0_s : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data

parameter.name: v_ion_eff_xcal
parameter.description: Effective ion speed derived from individual sweep (speed; always non-negative scalar), while assuming a specific ion mass. Cross-calibrated with RPCMIP

parameter.name: v_ion_eff_xcal : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data

parameter.name: v_ph_knee
parameter.description: Photoelectron knee potential

parameter.name: v_ph_knee : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data

parameter.name: quality flag
parameter.description: Quality flag constructed as the sum of multiple terms, depending on what quality related effects are present. Each digit is either in the range 0 (best) to 7 (worst), or 9 (not used)

dataset.name: e-field component (EFL)
dataset.desc:
Electric field component, calculated on ground by taking the difference between floating probe measurements on both probes and dividing by distance
MinSampling: 0.05S; MaxSampling: 35S
Provider: PSA

parameter.name: e-field comp
parameter.description: Electric field component, calculated on ground by taking the difference between floating probe measurements on both probes and dividing by distance, (V_P2-V_P1)/L. Positive value refers to electric field pointing in the direction from probe 1 to probe 2.

parameter.name: sampling conf
parameter.description: Number that describes the exact combination of onboard s/w averaging and downsampling. The exact values are pointers into a table that describes both the number of samples that are averaged over and the downsampling rate

parameter.name: quality flag
parameter.description: Quality flag constructed as the sum of multiple terms, depending on what quality related effects are present. Each digit is either in the range 0 (best) to 7 (worst), or 9 (not used).

dataset.name: plasma density (NED)
dataset.desc:
Plasma density derived from individual spacecraft potential measurements on one illuminated probe.
MinSampling: 32S; MaxSampling: 160S
Provider: PSA

parameter.name: n_e (ned)
parameter.description: Plasma density derived from individual spacecraft potential measurements on one illuminated probe

parameter.name: n_e : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best).Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data.

parameter.name: quality flag
parameter.description: Quality flag constructed as the sum of multiple terms, depending on what quality related effects are present. Each digit is either in the range 0 (best) to 7 (worst), or 9 (not used)

dataset.name: plasma density (NEL)
dataset.desc:
Plasma density which contains the highest time resolution cross-calibrated density data, when RPC-MIP is not delivering cross-calibrated density products
MinSampling: 0.016S; MaxSampling: 128S
Provider: PSA

parameter.name: n_e_good (qual_nel> 0.2)
parameter.description: Plasma density which contains the highest time resolution cross-calibrated density data, when RPC-MIP is not delivering cross-calibrated density products. Quality value > 0.2

parameter.name: n_e (nel)
parameter.description: Plasma density which contains the highest time resolution cross-calibrated density data, when RPC-MIP is not delivering cross-calibrated density products

parameter.name: n_e : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data.

parameter.name: quality flag
parameter.description: Quality flag constructed as the sum of multiple terms, depending on what quality related effects are present. Each digit is either in the range 0 (best) to 7 (worst), or 9 (not used)

dataset.name: photosaturation current (PHO)
dataset.desc:
Photosaturation current derived collectively from multiple sweeps
Sampling: 60S
Provider: PSA

parameter.name: i_ph0_60m : qual
parameter.description: Quality value in the range 0 (worst) to 1 (best). Corresponds to goodness of fit or how well the model fits the data.

parameter.name: quality flag
parameter.description: Quality flag constructed as the sum of multiple terms, depending on what quality related effects are present. Each digit is either in the range 0 (best) to 7 (worst), or 9 (not used)
